        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined individual.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Della Plumstone's offer with a price that is both profitable for him and still appealing to Della.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should carefully consider Della Plumstone's offer and his own profit margins before responding.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Della Plumstone's offer for the pears, but he should offer a price slightly lower than his initial asking price to show willingness to negotiate.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Della Plumstone's offer for the pears.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should offer Lennon Figtree a price that is slightly higher than his cost for the apples, but still lower than his usual selling price.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should consider Lennon Figtree's request and his own profit margins before responding.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he set out on his first solo journey as a travelling fruit merchant. He had inherited a small cart from his father and a handful of apples from his meager orchard. The open road beckoned, promising both opportunity and danger.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a cunning merchant who attempted to cheat him out of a fair price for his fruit. Cedric, however, was no fool. He countered the merchant's deceitful tactics with his own shrewd bargaining skills, ultimately securing a favorable deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Della Plumstone's offer for the pears, but he should offer a price slightly lower than his initial asking price to show willingness to negotiate.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer with a price that is slightly lower than his initial asking price.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer for the apples.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Della Plumstone's offer for the pears.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should offer Lennon Figtree a price that is slightly higher than his cost for the apples, but still lower than his usual selling price.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook should consider Lennon Figtree's request and his own profit margins before responding.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins


          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for a bushel of apples with Lennon Figtree.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Cedric Meadowbrook do next in this situation?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should counter Lennon Figtree's offer with a price that is slightly lower than his initial asking price.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 3 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 2
      Cedric Meadowbrook: -3
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': 'apple for 3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
      Della Plumstone -- "40 coins, Lennon. That's all I can offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a compassionate and resourceful entrepreneur.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than their initial offer, perhaps 45 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and try to find a price that is fair to both parties.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider offering a price slightly lower than Cedric Meadowbrook's asking price but higher than her own buying cost, aiming for a compromise.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should try to determine Cedric Meadowbrook's cost for the apples and aim for a price that allows both of them to make a reasonable profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's asking price, perhaps 7 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life.           Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating prices with customers. He bought apples, bananas, and pears for 5, 5, and 6 coins each, respectively.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating prices with customers. He bought apples, bananas, and pears for 5, 5, and 6 coins each, respectively.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a business negotiation at the Fruitville market.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and propose a price slightly lower than her initial offer, aiming for a compromise.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.

Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should try to determine Cedric Meadowbrook's cost for the apples and aim for a price that allows both of them to make a reasonable profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's asking price, perhaps 7 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.

          Question: What kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a business negotiation at the Fruitville market.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.
          Question: Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and propose a price slightly lower than her initial offer, aiming for a compromise.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:00:00

      • Summary of recent observations

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market, negotiating prices with customers like Della Plumstone. He purchased his inventory of apples, bananas, and pears at a cost of 5, 5, and 6 coins respectively.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is currently in a business negotiation at the Fruitville market.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a compassionate and resourceful entrepreneur.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than their initial offer, perhaps 45 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and try to find a price that is fair to both parties.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider offering a price slightly lower than Cedric Meadowbrook's asking price but higher than her own buying cost, aiming for a compromise.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life.           [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.

        • Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
      Della Plumstone -- "40 coins, Lennon. That's all I can offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone

      Action attempt
    • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.

          15 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase apples from Lennon Figtree at a discounted price to resell them for a profit.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase apples from Lennon Figtree at a discounted price to resell them for a profit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, they helped their mother sell apples at the local market. Della, mimicking the persuasive tones of the other vendors, quickly learned how to charm customers into buying more fruit than they intended.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 45 coins for a dozen apples or try to negotiate a lower price.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to try to negotiate a lower price.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "40 coins, Lennon. That's all I can offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • banana for 4 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating the price of apples with Lennon Figtree. Della wants to buy a dozen apples to resell in her hometown for a profit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for a dozen apples.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for a dozen apples.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) banana for 3 coins
          (b) apple for 6 coins
          (c) apple for 4 coins
          (d) banana for 5 coins
          (e) pear for 1 coins
          (f) banana for 2 coins
          (g) apple for 2 coins
          (h) banana for 6 coins
          (i) banana for 1 coins
          (j) pear for 5 coins
          (k) banana for 4 coins
          (l) apple for 3 coins
          (m) pear for 4 coins
          (n) apple for 1 coins
          (o) pear for 3 coins
          (p) apple for 5 coins
          (q) pear for 6 coins
          (r) pear for 2 coins
          Answer: (k)

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer

        • Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for a dozen apples.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and try to find a price that is fair to both parties.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should try to determine Cedric Meadowbrook's cost for the apples and aim for a price that allows both of them to make a reasonable profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider offering a price slightly lower than Cedric Meadowbrook's asking price but higher than her own buying cost, aiming for a compromise.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's asking price, perhaps 7 coins a bushel.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and propose a price slightly lower than her initial offer, aiming for a compromise.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price for apples with Della Plumstone, who has counter-offered a price for bananas. The current date and time is September 15, 1895, between 12:10 AM and 12:15 AM.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price for apples with Della Plumstone, who has counter-offered a price for bananas. The current date and time is September 15, 1895, between 12:10 AM and 12:15 AM.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed a beggar woman collapse from exhaustion in the marketplace. Lennon Figtree shared their meager lunch of bread and fruit with the woman, earning a grateful smile that warmed their heart.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they helped their father barter for a cart and some fruit to sell. Lennon Figtree learned the art of negotiation, always striving for a fair deal for both sides.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they traveled to a neighboring village with their father to sell their fruit. They were struck by the poverty they saw and vowed to use their skills to help those less fortunate.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they took over the family fruit business after their father fell ill. Lennon Figtree traveled far and wide, bringing fresh fruit to remote villages and always offering a helping hand to those in need.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, they established a small trading post in a bustling town square. Lennon Figtree made sure to sell their fruit at affordable prices, ensuring that everyone could enjoy the sweetness of fresh produce.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price for apples with Della Plumstone. Della has counter-offered a price for bananas.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should counter Della Plumstone's offer for bananas with a price slightly lower than her offer, aiming for a compromise.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should counter Della Plumstone's offer for bananas with a price slightly lower than her offer, aiming for a compromise.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)
        Question_3
      • Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Key

        • Question: Given the past actions, what should Lennon Figtree do next in this situation?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree should counter Della Plumstone's offer for bananas with a price slightly lower than her offer, aiming for a compromise.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and try to find a price that is fair to both parties.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should try to determine Cedric Meadowbrook's cost for the apples and aim for a price that allows both of them to make a reasonable profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider offering a price slightly lower than Cedric Meadowbrook's asking price but higher than her own buying cost, aiming for a compromise.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 3 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should counteroffer with a price slightly lower than Cedric's asking price, perhaps 7 coins a bushel.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and compassionate businesswoman.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should carefully assess Della Plumstone's needs and preferences to determine a fair price for his fruit that will be mutually beneficial.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree should consider Della Plumstone's previous offer and propose a price slightly lower than her initial offer, aiming for a compromise.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Lennon Figtree: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': 'banana for 4 coins', 'Lennon Figtree': 'reject'}

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, these apples are the finest in the market.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, these apples are the finest in the market.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, these apples are the finest in the county. I can let you have a dozen for 50 coins, but that's my best price.
      Della Plumstone -- "40 coins, Lennon. That's all I can offer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, you know I always give you a fair price, but these apples are particularly fine this season. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins apiece.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, you know I value your produce, but 5 coins is a bit steep for me.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I'd like to buy a bushel of apples, Cedric.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "A bushel of apples, you say? Well, Lennon, those are prime specimens, the finest in Fruitville. I can let you have them for 8 coins a bushel.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we say 45 coins for a dozen apples? It's a good deal for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I value your apples, but 45 coins is a bit steep for me.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, these apples are the finest in the market.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, my dear, these apples are the finest in the market.
      Context for action selection and components

          Answer

        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a shrewd and determined businessman.
